creator: tom@mindcontract.com
text:
On Redhat 9.0

I am getting an error when I restart my apache2 server. 

[emerg] (38) Couldn't create accept lock

When I reboot the server, the apache server comes up fine.
When I attempt to restart the server I get the error above.

This is with RedHat's apache or our apache?

Can you get strace of parent process across restart showing the failure to
create the mutex?

What about non-default mutex types?  Try using "AcceptMutex fcntl".
creator: trawick@apache.org
chip@force-elite.com
text: no user feedback on a platform I use.  Works for me.
